PRIME MINISTER PRESS STATEMENT NO. 200
8 March 1974
TEMPORARY ASSISTANCE AUTHORITY AND INDUSTRIES ASSISTANCE
COMMISSION REFERENCES -MUSHROOMS
The Prime Minister, Mr. Whitlam, today announced
that he had sent references to the Temporary Assistance
Authority and the Industries Assistance Commission on the
questions of temporary and long-term assistance for the
Australian industry producing mushrooms and prepared or
preserved mushrooms.
Mr. Whitlam said that both the Minister for
Primary Industry and he had received representations
from and on behalf of the Australian mushroom growing
industry and after considering a report prepared by the
Department of Primary Industry he had reached the conclusion
that prima facie cases for the references had been
established by the industry.
Mr. Whitlam made the point that the reference to
the Temporary Assistance Authority was the first to be
sent under the Industries Assistance Commission Act 1973.
Under the Act the Authority is required to report to the
Government on the question of temporary assistance no
later than thirty days from the date of the reference.
CANBERRA, A. C. T.
